node.statement: Global obstruction analysis: No topological, symplectic, or Floer-theoretic obstructions prevent the smoothing. (a) Maslov class: piecewise constant on faces, with even local Maslov index at each 4-valent vertex; compatible with smooth Lagrangian Maslov classes. (b) Floer theory: R^4 is exact symplectic, so no non-constant holomorphic disks with boundary on exact Lagrangians; m_0=0 and Floer theory is unobstructed. (c) Non-orientability: ruled out as input by Shevchishin-Nemirovski (no embedded Lagrangian Klein bottle in R^4) combined with chi(L)=0 for compact Lagrangians. (d) Monodromy: the parameter space of local smoothings at each vertex is contractible (product of half-lines), so no monodromy obstruction prevents global consistency.
